skills.name: Calculate the range from a list of data

explanations.A: If something is variable it changes or is not consistent. Therefore, variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other, how they change.
explanations.B: Not quite. Variability does not tell us about the average. Remember, if something is variable it changes or is not consistent.
explanations.C: Not quite. Variability does not tell us how many. Remember, if something is variable it changes or is not consistent.
explanations.D: Not quite. Variability does not measure likelihood or chance. Remember, if something is variable it changes or is not consistent.

explanations.A: Not quite. Variability does not measure probability or chance. Remember, if something is variable it changes or is not consistent.
explanations.B: Not quite. Variability does not tell us how many. Remember, if something is variable it changes or is not consistent.
explanations.C: Not quite. Variability does not measure the most frequent data point. Remember, if something is variable it changes or is not consistent.
explanations.D: If something is variable it changes or is not consistent. Therefore, variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other, how they change.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. If data points are similar, then they will have values relatively close to each other.
explanations.B: Variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. So a data set with high variability means the data points are very different from each other. Therefore Katie is correct and Tom is incorrect.
explanations.C: Not quite. They cannot both be correct. Remember, variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other.
explanations.D: Not quite. As they have opposing views, one of them must be correct. Remember, variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. A data set can have a large number of data points and still have low variability.
explanations.B: Variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. To calculate it we compare the values of the data points within a set. A data set with high variability means that the values of the points are very different. Therefore Katie is correct. Tom is incorrect as it is not the number of data points that determine the variability. You could have a large data set with low variability if all the data points take similar values.
explanations.C: Not quite. Look carefully at each statement. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. Is it possible to have a large data set with low variability? Is it the number of data points OR the value of the data points that determine the variaibility?
explanations.D: Not quite. Look carefully at each statement. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. Is it the number of data points OR the value of the data points that determine the variaibility?

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. This data set only has one data point so there is no variability.
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. The 4 data points in this set all take the same value, so there is no variability.
explanations.C: Variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. A data set would have most variability if the values within the set are the most different. In this set, the lowest value is 7 and the highest value is 200. These values have the biggest difference, and therefore this is the set with the most variability.
explanations.D: Not quite. I think you thought this was the most variable as it has the greatest number of data points. But remember, variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. The data points in this set all have similar values, so there is low variability.

explanations.A: Not quite. I think you thought this was the most variable as it has the greatest number of data points. But remember, variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. The data points in this set all have similar values, so there is low variability.
explanations.B: Variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. A data set would have most variability if the values within the set are the most different. In this set, the lowest value is 12 and the highest value is 100. These values have the biggest difference, and therefore this is the set with the most variability.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. The 4 data points in this set all take the same value, so there is no variability.
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember variability measures how data points within a set are different from each other. This data set only has one data point so there is no variability.

explanations.A: Not quite. A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the cost of a small bucket of popcorn, at the same cinema, everyday for one month, then we woud not expect the data set to have high variability. You might see some small price changes but these would be relatively small, leading to a data set with low variability.
explanations.B: Not quite. A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the number of screens at the same cinema, everyday for one month, then we would expect the data set to have little to no variability, as you would not expect the number of screens to change.
explanations.C: Not quite. A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the opening time of the same cinema, everyday for one month, then we woud not expect the data set to have high variability. You might see some time changes but these would be relatively small, leading to a data set with low variability.
explanations.D: A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the number of visitors to a cinema everyday for one month, then we woud expect the data set to have variability. You would expect high data values on Friday or Saturday and lower data values on a Monday, therefore we would expect this option to produce the data set with the most variability.

explanations.A: A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. Recording student absences every day, for one month, could produce a variable data set. There could be some days with lots of students absent and some with hardly any. Therefore, we would expect this data set, in comparison to the others, to produce the most variable data.
explanations.B: Not quite. A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the time of the first lesson in a school, everyday for one month, then we woud not expect the data set to have high variability. You might see some slight time changes but these would be relatively small, leading to a data set with low variability.
explanations.C: Not quite. A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the cost of a bottle of water, in the cafeteria of the same school, everyday for one month, then we woud not expect the data set to have high variability. You might see some small price changes but these would be relatively small, leading to a data set with low variability.
explanations.D: Not quite. A data set is variable if the data points are very different to each other. If we recorded the number of classrooms at the same school, everyday for one month, then we would expect the data set to have little to no variability, as you would not expect the number of classrooms to change.

explanations.A: Not quite. The data set with the greatest variability is the one with the highest range. As all the data points take the same value, this set of data has a range of 0. Remember the range is the highest value minus the lowest value.
explanations.B: Not quite. Despite this data set containing the lowest value there is a data set that has a higher range. Remember the range is the highest value minus the lowest value.
explanations.C: Not quite. Despite having the most data, this data set does not have the greatest variabililty, as it does not have the highest range. Remember the range is the highest value minus the lowest value.
explanations.D: The data set with the greatest variability is the one with the highest range. We calculate the range by subtracting the lowest value from the highest. As the range of this data set is 18 (36 - 18), and therefore higher than all the other options, this data set is the one with the greatest variability.

explanations.A: Not quite. The data set with the greatest variability is the one with the highest range. The range of this data set is 19 (42 - 23). Check the others carefully as I think there is a data set with a greater range than this!
explanations.B: The data set with the greatest variability is the one with the highest range. We calculate the range by subtracting the lowest value from the highest. As the range of this data set is 21 (21 - 0), and therefore higher than all the other options, this data set is the one with the greatest variability.
explanations.C: Not quite. Despite having the most data, this data set does not have the greatest variabililty, as it does not have the highest range. Remember the range is the highest value minus the lowest value.
explanations.D: Not quite. The data set with the greatest variability is the one with the highest range. As all the data points take the same value, this set of data has a range of 0. Remember the range is the highest value minus the lowest value.
